So, putting it all together, Javier probably thinks about fairness and reciprocity when deciding how much to give. He might not want to end up losing his own money if the other guy isn't interested in returning it. Therefore, he'd likely choose a minimal amount or maybe none at all because he's unsure of the other person's intentions.

I think the key here is understanding that without knowing each other, there's no guarantee of reciprocity. Javier might prioritize not losing his own money over any potential gain from the other guy, especially if he doesn't have reason to believe there will be a return.
